User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the VLSI Interview Ace platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity (matches Firebase Auth UID).

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

registrationDate.description: Date and time the user registered.

Interview.title: Interview
Interview.description: Represents a completed mock interview session and its performance report.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Interview entity.

userId.description: The UID of the user who completed the interview.

role.description: The VLSI job role for which the interview was conducted.

date.description: The date and time the interview was completed.

strengths.description: A summary of the candidate's strengths.

areasForImprovement.description: A summary of areas where the candidate can improve.

actionableFeedback.description: Specific, actionable feedback for the user.

transcript.description: The full transcript of the interview.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Uses the Firebase Auth UID as the document ID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores performance reports for each mock interview a user completes. This is a subcollection under the user's document.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

params.name: interviewId
params.description: The unique ID of the interview report.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure is designed to support the VLSI Interview Ace platform. User data is stored in a dedicated collection (`/users/{userId}`). Interview reports are stored in a subcollection (`/users/{userId}/interviews/{interviewId}`) under each user. This path-based ownership ensures that a user's interview data is directly associated with them and simplifies security rules, allowing users to only access their own reports.
